node.title: Ashes Watch: Who is making their case for Australian Test selection?
node.alt: Sean Abbott, Usman Khawaja and Marcus Harris
node.description: With a little over a month until the first ball at the Gabba, some experienced figures and rising stars are putting their hands up for a spot in Australia's Ashes Test team.Â
node.content:
["With a little over a month until the first ball at the Gabba, and the England squad soon to be en route,\u00a0speculation and debate around the make-up of Australia's Ashes squad is about to ramp up.", "It's been the best part of a year since Australia's men suited up for a Test match \u2014 a quite remarkable loss to depleted India in Brisbane, no less \u2014 so opportunities for players looking to break into the team have been scarce.", "But the 2021/22 Sheffield Shield season, creatively repurposed to avoid the many lurking COVID complications, is that opportunity for any cricketer dreaming of an Ashes berth.", "", "
Australia hasn't played a Test match since the loss to India in Brisbane in January.(AAP: Darren England)
", "When we last left it, the Australian Test team was unsettled, and injuries in recent months have only muddied the waters further.", "As New South Wales and Victoria begin their second bubbled Shield clash, let's take a moment to check out the lay of the land and whose cases are becoming the most compelling.", "
The batters
", "It is safe to assume that David Warner, Steve Smith and Marnus Labuschagne are locks for the first Test. That leaves three top-six spots with various levels of vacancy to fight for.", "Cameron Green is the incumbent at number six, and is likely to hold his spot off the back of a solid start to the Shield season \u2014 though runs have been a little harder to come by since his\u00a0106 against South Australia in September.", "The second opening spot is a tricky one. Will Pucovski might have been at the front of the list, but his running concussion ordeal has scuppered the early part of his season and increased fears for his long-term health.", "Marcus Harris may be the natural next option, and his epic second-innings 137\u00a0(off 361 balls) against New South Wales was a good reminder of his fighting traits at the top of the order.", "Another option could be Usman Khawaja, whose versatility in the batting order has been both a strength and a perceived weakness throughout his Test career. Khawaja has started this Shield season on fire, with two tons in his first three matches, and would not be out of place in the top or middle order of Australia's batting lineup.", "", "
Travis Head has been piling on the runs in Sheffield Shield and 50-over cricket this season.(Getty Images: James Elsby)
", "The number five spot is another that Australia has struggled to fill consistently, but the scorching form of Travis Head may have made that call a little easier too.", "Head took WA for 163 in September, before hitting a remarkable double century in a 50-over match a few weeks later. Like Harris, he has never truly made a Test spot his own \u2014 but also like Harris, he might be impossible to ignore given the circumstances.", "
The bowlers
", "The starting bowling positions for Australia are probably easier to pick.", "Barring injury, Pat Cummins, Mitchell Starc, Josh Hazlewood and Nathan Lyon will carry the hosts into the first Test in Brisbane.", "", "
Sean Abbott could see a Test debut this summer if an incumbant quick is injured or rested.(Getty Images: Cameron Spencer)
", "But the recent retirement of James Pattinson means there is vacancy as the next cab off the rank, and a few quicks have put their hands up as viable candidates.", "Sean Abbott was named in the squad for Australia's cancelled tour to South Africa earlier this year, and is unlikely to have fallen far in the selector's estimations after an impressive first outing against Victoria.", "Mark Steketee is another to have found himself among the wickets at Shield level, and Michael Neser perhaps already should have a Test to his name.", "Among the spinners, Mitchell Swepson was also named in that South Africa squad and may again be seen as a ready deputy for Lyon, though fellow Queenslander Matthew Kuhnemann has made a mighty impressive start to the season with\u00a0his left-arm finger-spin.", "
The wicketkeepers
", "We don't yet know if this is even a conversation worth having, and all reports seem to suggest that captain Tim Paine will recover from his neck injury and subsequent surgery in time for the Ashes.", "But if he doesn't, Australia's keeping stocks are arguably as high as they have been for years.", "Alex Carey has been next in line for some time, and it would be harsh for the South Australian to be leapfrogged should the position become available.", "", "
Alex Carey has been next in line with the gloves for a while now.(AAP: Albert Perez)
", "But selectors are clearly impressed by Josh Inglis, who is currently part of the national T20 World Cup squad and scored three Shield hundreds last season.", "Another candidate is Queensland's Jimmy Peirson, who has two Shield tons already this season and is as good a gloveman as any in the country.", "But in all likelihood, these are players that will be forced to bide their time a little longer\u00a0as little will stop Paine fronting up in Brisbane."]
